rules: Rule1: If the customer invests in stocks, then they receive dividends from stocks.
Rule2: Under the condition that the customer pays low fees, they get portfolio rebalancing.

Rule3: If the customer uses a mobile app, then either they achieve financial goals or if the absence of the implication that using a robo-advisor leads to paying low fees holds, the customer experiences technical issues.
Rule4: Either the customer uses a mobile app, or they visit a branch.

Rule5: Whenever the customer visits a branch, then either they achieve financial goals, or if it is not the case that using a robo-advisor results in paying low fees, then technical issues are experienced by the customer.
Rule6: Provided that the customer owns high-risk assets in stocks, they do not receive dividends from stocks.
Rule7: If the customer has a financial advisor, then whenever they invest in stocks, they own high-risk assets in stocks.
Rule8: Either the customer qualifies for premium service, or they have a financial advisor.
Rule9: Under the condition that the customer has credit issues, it is not the case that they qualify for premium service.
Rule10: Under the condition that the customer receives automated advice, they have a financial advisor.
Rule11: Provided that the customer gets portfolio rebalancing, they receive automated advice.
Rule12: Whenever it is not the case that using a robo-advisor leads to paying low fees, it is not the case that the customer experiences technical issues.
Rule13: Provided that the customer does not have initial capital, they invest in stocks.
facts: Fact1: The customer has credit issues.
Fact2: The customer uses a robo-advisor.
Fact3: The customer does not achieve financial goals.
